commentary: Rg6+: double rook sac; both rooks en prise, the only winning move.
…hxg6: grabbing a rook; any capture leads to the same attacking structure.
Qa1!!: quiet retreat, effectively sacrificing the second rook while lining up the long diagonal.
…Kxf7: accepting the second rook; other captures transpose.
Qf6+: queen invades with tempo, driving the king back.
…Kg8: only square; alternatives lose faster.
Bh6!: shuts down counterplay and keeps the attack rolling—white is winning.
…Re8: best try to guard g7, but too slow.
Qg7#: mate on the dark-squared diagonal; queen is protected by Bh6.

precomputed_metrics.notes: DeepMind puzzle; 1.Rg6+ is unique winning move; deep engine eval is winning for White.

commentary: Ra6!: deflects the a8-king’s defender; black is forced to take.
…bxa6: only capture; the b-pawn is now unstoppable.
b7#: quiet pawn mate, king trapped on b8.
Bh1!: retreats to set up the g2–a8 diagonal, keeping control of checks.
…Kxa2: grabbing the knight, but walking into the net.
Qg2#: long-diagonal mate; bishop on h1 covers g2, queen delivers.
Rf4!: rook lift to deflect the dark-squared bishop.
…Bxf4: only try; bishop leaves c5 unguarded.
Qc5#: diagonal mate; king boxed by its own pieces.
Rc3!: rook sacrifice to open the c-file and lure the b-pawn.
…bxc3: forced capture; diagonal is now opened.
Bc2#: bishop mate along the long diagonal; rook removal cleared the path.
Rf6!: rook lift to set up Qc4; also blocks counterplay.
…Kc5: best king flight, but still doomed.
Qc4#: queen slides to c4 delivering mate; rook guards f-file squares.
Nd4!: deflects the queen and opens the g-file for the rook.
…Qxb7: taking the loose pawn; queen is off the defense.
Rg4#: rook swings to g4 for mate; knights and queen cut off escape.
